file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 32-10-04-04 - MAIN LANDING GEAR AUXILIARY BRACE STRUT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL MAIN LANDING GEAR AUXILIARY BRACE STRUT - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the auxiliary brace strut of the main landing gear. B. These procedures are applicable to the LH and RH Main Landing Gears (MLG). C. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY AUXILIARY BRACE STRUT OF THE MAIN ALL 32-10-04-000-801-A LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL AUXILIARY BRACE STRUT OF THE MAIN ALL 32-10-04-400-801-A LANDING GEAR - INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 32-10-04 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-10-04-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. AUXILIARY BRACE STRUT OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the auxiliary brace strut of the main landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-801-A/200 - SPRING ASSEMBLIES OF THE MAIN LANDING AMM TASK 32-10-05-000-801-A/400 GEAR - REMOVAL UNLOCKING ACTUATOR OF THE MAIN LANDING AMM TASK 32-33-09-000-801-A/400 GEAR - REMOVAL AMM TASK 32-61-02-000-801-A/400 DOWNLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - REMOVAL TASK 52-12-02-000-801-A - C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH or LH Main landing gear I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, open the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) Make sure that the pressure in hydraulic system 1 is fully released. (3) Release the pressure of the MLG Pax - Door ACCUM (TASK 52-12-02-000-801-A). (4) Lift the aircraft on jacks. Refer to AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-801-A/200. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-10-04 Page 2 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (5) Disconnect the lower ends of the spring assemblies ( AMM TASK 32-10-05-000-801-A/ 400). (6) Disconnect the lower end of the MLG unlock actuator (AMM TASK 32-33-09-000-801- A/400). (7) Remove the downlock proximity switches ( AMM TASK 32-61-02-000-801-A/400). J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the cotter pin (1), nut (2), washer (3), and bolt (4). (2) Remove the cotter pin (6), nut (7), washers (8) and (9), and bolt (10). (3) Remove the auxiliary brace strut (5). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-10-04 Page 3 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Auxiliary Brace Strut of the Main Landing Gear - Removal/Installation Figure 401 LG DOWNLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCHES SPRING ASSEMBLIES A A ZONE ZONE 721 731 6. COTTERPIN MLG LEG 1 MAIN BRACE STRUT 7. NUT 8. WASHER MLG UNLOCK DET. A ACTUATOR B 9. WASHER AUXILIARY BRACE STRUCTURE 10. BOLT STRUT (WING) MAIN BRACE STRUT 5. AUXILIARY BRACE STRUT 2. NUT 4. BOLT 1. COTTERPIN DET. B 3. WASHER 1 TORQUE: 3.4 TO 4.5 N.m (30 TO 40 lb.in) EM145AMM320125D.DGN EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 32-10-04 Page 4 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 32-10-04-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. AUXILIARY BRACE STRUT OF THE MAIN LANDING GEAR - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the auxiliary brace strut of the main landing gear. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-802-A/200 - LANDING GEAR AND MAIN DOOR ACCUMULATOR - AMM TASK 12-13-06-600-801-A/300 CHARGE SPRING ASSEMBLIES OF THE MAIN LANDING AMM TASK 32-10-05-400-801-A/400 GEAR - INSTALLATION EXTENSION AND RETRACTION SYSTEM - OPERA- AMM TASK 32-30-00-700-801-A/500 TIONAL CHECK UNLOCKING ACTUATOR OF THE MAIN LANDING AMM TASK 32-33-09-400-801-A/400 GEAR - INSTALLATION AMM TASK 32-61-02-400-801-A/400 DOWNLOCK PROXIMITY SWITCH - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) MS24665-287 Cotter pin 1 MS24665-136 Cotter pin 1 G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task RH or LH Main landing gear EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-10-04 Page 5 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Put the auxiliary brace strut (5) in its installation position between the main brace strut and the support at the wing structure. (2) Install the bolt (10), washers (8) and (9), and nut (7) to attach the auxiliary brace strut (5) to the support at the wing structure. (3) Apply a torque of 3.4 to 4.5 N.m (30 to 40 lb.in) on the nut (7). (4) Install the bolt (4), washer (3), and nut (2) to attach the auxiliary brace strut (5) to the main brace strut. (5) Tighten the nut (2) until a nut slot is aligned with bolt hole. NOTE: Do not loosen the nut (2) to align the hole. (6) Install the cotter pin (1) (MS24665-287) and safety the nut (2). (7) Install the cotter pin (6) (MS24665-136) and safety the nut (7). J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Connect the lower ends of the spring assemblies ( AMM TASK 32-10-05-400-801-A/ 400). (2) Connect the lower end of the MLG unlock actuator (AMM TASK 32-33-09-400-801-A/ 400). (3) Install the downlock proximity switches ( AMM TASK 32-61-02-400-801-A/400). (4) Pressurize the MLG Pax - Door ACCUM (AMM TASK 12-13-06-600-801-A/300). (5) On the Circuit Breaker Panel, close the ELEC PUMP 1 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (6) Energize the aircraft. (7) Do the operational test of the extension and retraction system. Refer to AMM TASK 32-30-00-700-801-A/500. (8) Lower the aircraft and remove the jacks. Refer to AMM TASK 07-10-00-500-802-A/ 200. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 32-10-04 Page 6 of 6 Rev 49 - Feb 16/16 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
